output_text: {"id":"spec-audit-3step-plan","steps":[{"name":"Check completeness and structure","ok":true,"reason":"Verify the document has all required sections (scope, goals/non-goals, requirements, assumptions, constraints, dependencies, risks, acceptance criteria) and that each section is populated, unambiguous, and internally consistent."},{"name":"Validate requirements quality and traceability","ok":true,"reason":"Review each requirement for clarity, testability, and measurability; remove duplicates; resolve conflicts; ensure each requirement maps to a user need/business objective and has acceptance criteria and a unique identifier for traceability."},{"name":"Assess feasibility, risks, and stakeholder alignment","ok":true,"reason":"Confirm technical feasibility and resource constraints; identify edge cases and failure modes; review security/privacy/compliance impacts; ensure open questions are tracked with owners and due dates; obtain sign-off from key stakeholders."}],"final":"Audit the spec by (1) confirming it is complete and well-structured, (2) ensuring requirements are clear, testable, and traceable, and (3) validating feasibility, risks, and stakeholder alignment with documented decisions and sign-off."}
